name: LIT 230B
title: Narrative Theory
description: A survey of 20th-century narratology, emphasizing structuralist and poststructuralist theories of narrative. May be repeated for credit.

pre_req_data.text: Enrollment is restricted to graduate students.

class_notes: This is course is an introduction to narrative theory and an exploration of the analytical use of narrative for a variety of literary and non-literary writing, with a focus on pre-modern material and the use and presence of narrative in religion, law, and historical writing. We explore how thinking about narrative can give us tools to talk about a wide set of discursive and social practices, such as religious polemic and apology, conversion, and legal disputation.
